known_issues: Administration tab and its sections (Documents, Benches, Users) are not translated/localized.
Bench history view (after clicking "see details") is not translated/localized.

existing_features.title: Localize the Admin page header and tab labels by replacing hardcoded strings in `frontend/src/pages/Admin/AdminPage.tsx` with `useI18n().t(...)` keys (Admin title, description, and the tabs: Benches/Documents/Users).

Localize all remaining user-facing strings in the Admin panels (`frontend/src/pages/Admin/components/AdminBenchesPanel.tsx` and `frontend/src/pages/Admin/components/AdminDocumentsPanel.tsx`), including: loading states, empty states, section titles/descriptions, dialog titles/descriptions/buttons, fallback texts (e.g., missing AGILE code), and toast success/error messages.

Ensure the bench history view is localized when viewing a bench after clicking “View details”: in `frontend/src/pages/Benches/components/BenchHistoryList.tsx`, display localized labels for history entry actions (and any other user-facing history strings) instead of rendering the raw `entry.action` text directly. Implement a robust mapping that can translate existing stored action strings (e.g., previously-written values) and falls back to the raw string if unknown.

Extend the i18n key set in `frontend/src/i18n/translations.ts` to include all new Admin and history-related translation keys required by REQ-1/REQ-2/REQ-3, and provide values for both `fr-FR` and `en-US`. Use English text for the `en-US` values.

new_feature_requests.summary: Use the current app language/locale when formatting timestamps in the bench history list so dates render according to the selected language (e.g., `toLocaleString(currentLocale)`), rather than the browser default locale.

projectName: Complete i18n coverage for Admin area and Bench history view
